topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 1.1: Support Matrix

body.p:
To ensure the performance and stability of the HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade, it is very important to meet the requirements and conform to the recommendations listed in this document.
Supported Hardware
Required Hardware Configuration
Software Requirements
Supported Guest Operating Systems
Typical Configurations
The hardware requirements and configurations are different, depending upon the topology: KVM or KVM + ESX. See the Technical Overview for more information on these topologies.

section.title: Supported Hardware
section.p: The following servers are supported for the lifecycle manager host, and for the controllers and compute servers.
Note: For the KVM + ESX cloud, consult the DCN and ESX documentation for the supported hardware.
Lifecycle Manager Host The lifecycle manager host is a single server with at least a 40 GB disk size and 8,192 MB RAM.

Comtrollers and compute servers The following servers are supported for the controllers and compute servers in both the Non-KVM region and KVM region. The servers must meet the specifications in the Required Specifications table below:

ul.li: If you are using Gen9 systens, you must update the firmware to HPE Service Pack for ProLiant (SPP) Version 2015.06.0.
If you are using Gen8 systems, you will experience reduced performance.

section.title: Required Hardware Configurations
section.p: The servers, selected from the Supported Hardware lists, must be configured as follows for HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade.
Lifecycle Manager Host. You must have a server with a 40GB Disk and 8,192 MB RAM for the HLM host.
HPE Helion OpenStack Controllers. You must have three (3) baremetal systems to install the HPE Helion OpenStack controllers that meet the following requirements:

ul.li: For systems with multiple NICs, only one NIC may be active or connected.

Capable of hosting VMs
Important: Since the installer currently uses only the first available disk, all servers must have RAID controllers pre-configured to present their storage as a single, logical disk. RAID across multiple physical discs is strongly recommended for both performance and resilience.
Notes:
On the controller nodes, make sure the RAID array is configured to reflect a total size of less than 4TB.
The root volume cannot exceed 2TB

section.p: KVM controllers. You must have two (2) baremetal systems to install the KVM region controllers. For systems with multiple NICs, only one NIC may be active or connected.
KVM compute servers. You must have two (2) or more baremetal systems to install the KVM region compute servers.
KVM region NICs. The following NICs have been verified for PXE booting of KVM region servers:
Important: Using the correct NICs is essential to proper installation of HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade.

b.i: For a KVM and ESX cloud topology

ul.li:
ESX components. You must have a minimum of two (2) baremetal systems for ESXi hosts. 1 - 4 ESXi clusters are supported. Refer to the ESX documentation for the supported hardware configurations.
vSphere Cluster running ESXi 5.5u2 with vMotion enabled.
1 Virtual Machine Port Group with all Cloud Vlans associated to the Port Group.
Note: These systems are not required for a KVM-only cloud.

DCN components. You must have:
two (2) baremetal systems for DCN VSC controllers (HA mode)
two (2) baremetal systems for DCN VRS-G Software Gateway (HA mode)
VRSvApp requirements VRSvApp must be installed. Please Refer to the DCN VSP 3.0 R7 installation Guide for VRSvApp installation.
Refer to the DCN documentation for the supported hardware configurations.
Note: These systems are not required for a KVM-only cloud.

section.title: Software Requirements
section.p: Lifecycle Manager Host. The lifecycle manager host requires the Ubuntu Server 14.04.2 LTS operating system.
HPE Helion OpenStack Controllers. The servers should be baremetal. The HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade installation process installs the required software.
KVM controllers. The servers should be baremetal. The HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade installation process installs the required software.
KVM compute. The servers should be baremetal. The HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade installation process installs the required software.
For a KVM and ESX cloud topology, VMware vSphere must be fully installed and operational before installing HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade.

body.section:
Supported Guest Operating Systems The following guest operating systems (guest OSs) are supported for the HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade servers.
Lifecycle Manager Host. There are no supported guest OSs for the lifecycle manager host server.
HP Helion OpenStack Controllers. There are no supported guest OSs for the servers that host the HPE Helion OpenStack Controllers.
KVM compute and controllers. The following Guest OSs are supported for the servers in the KVM region for both cloud topologies:
WindRiver Linux 6.0
WindRiver Linux 5.0
CentOS 6.4
Fedora 19
RHEL 6.5
OpenSUSE 12.3
For a KVM and ESX cloud topology, the following guest OSs are supported for the servers in the Non-KVM region, when configured with ESX-DCN:
Cirros 3.2
RHEL6.5
Ubuntu 14.04
